intro: Oxypetalum deltoideum, commonly known as the delta oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its deltoid-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils.
